text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
The following outlines changes made to IRM 2.4.28, IDRS Terminal Input, Command Codes STAUP, STATI and STATB.

IRM Subsection Description IRM 2.4.28.7.1, CC STAUP, STATI, STATB Input Items Revisions to paragraph (7): • Converted paragraph (e) to a bullet list for clarity. • Converted paragraph (f) to a bullet list for clarity. IRM 2.4.7.3, CC STAUP, STATI, STATB Tax Module Re- quirements (IMF, BMF, IRAF) • Revised paragraph (4) items (a), (e), and (h) to reﬂect process changes allowing Field Collection (ICS) to request Status 22 when the current Status is 26. (2) Editorial Changes: #### ### #### ##### ## ######
Added the title of the IRM subsections to citation;
Changed “latest (most current)” or “latest” to “current” for clarity;
Changed “earliest (oldest)” to “oldest” for clarity;
The terms “Assignment Code” and “Branch Group code” are used throughout for consistency. Prior versions had varied uses of Number or Num or CD and different capitalizations;
LB&I, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.

Program Scope and Objectives

Command Codes STAUP, STATI and STATB 2.4.28 page
and (
) Purpose: This IRM section describes IDRS Terminal Input Command Code STAUP. (
) Audience: All IRS business units. (
) Program Owner: Account Services, which is under the Director, Internal Man- agement (
) Primary Stakeholders: Wage & Investment (W&I), Large Business and Inter- national (LB&I), Small Business Self Employed (SB/SE), and Tax Exempt and Government Entities (TE/GE) (
) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance to allow a user to request IDRS status updates. (

) Status update requests are accomplished via Command Code STAUP. The command code is used for modules that are or have been balance due modules. Command Code STAUP is valid for IMF, BMF, IRAF, and NMF. Command Code STAUP can update certain IDRS statuses real-time or request that a speciﬁc status and notice be issued during a weekly update. See IRM
, CC STAUP Notice Requests. (

) Input of Command Code STAUP causes a history item to be generated in the Action History Section of the tax module. The history item contains the current date, the terminal operator employee number, the Action History Source Code and the activity code STAUP nnnn . (nnnn = the status requested plus the number of cycles delay, if present, requested by the terminal operator.) (
) Input of Command Code STAUP also causes the tax module’s IDRS status update real-time. The module updates to either status
, status
, or the status requested as appropriate. (
) In addition to updating statuses, STAUP has the capability of updating assign- ments in the Entity Case Assignment Section and marking the last issued CP
notice as destroyed in the Notice History Section. (
) Command Code STAUP will not process modules with MFT Codes
and
Also, modules with MFT Code
and EO-
- STATUS-IND =
will not be processed. (
) Command Code STAUP will process MFT Code
for the new Annual Form
of the Quarterly Form
which has MFT-CD =
for a BMF TIN Account. The MFT-CD
will also be processed for an NMF Account, See IRM
, CC STAUP NMF Status Update Request, when executing CC STAUP and CC STATB. (
) IRM
, Field Collection Procedures - Collection Inventory, provides an overview of the systemic collection inventory routing systems. (
) Applications Development is responsible for the maintenance of Command Code STAUP. Codes STAUP, STATI and STATB

Purpose: This IRM section describes IDRS Terminal Input Command Code
Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance to allow a user to request IDRS status updates.

Input of Command Code STAUP causes a history item to be generated in the Action History Section of the tax module. The history item contains the current date, the terminal operator employee number, the Action History Source Code and the activity code STAUP nnnn . (nnnn = the status requested plus the number of cycles delay, if present, requested by the terminal operator.)
IRM 5.1.20, Field Collection Procedures - Collection Inventory, provides an overview of the systemic collection inventory routing systems.

2.4.28.1.4(01-01-2023) Program Management and Review (1) Command Code STAUP validates the user input and provides either a “Request Completed” message or Error Codes, prompting the user to correct the information. 2.4.28.1.5(01-01-2023) Program Controls (1) SACS controls all IDRS user accesses and permissions. 2.4.28.1.6(01-01-2023) Terms/Deﬁnitions/Acronyms (1) Commonly used Acronyms in this IRM. Acronym Meaning BMF Business Master File CC Command Code CSED Collection Statute Expiration Date FC Field Collection EPMF Employee Plan Master File IDRS Integrated Data Retrieval System IMF Individual Master File IRAF Individual Retirement Account File NMF Non-Master File TC Transaction Code TIF Taxpayer Information File
Command Code STAUP validates the user input and provides either a “Request Completed” message or Error Codes, prompting the user to correct the information.

Acronym Meaning BMF Business Master File CC Command Code CSED Collection Statute Expiration Date FC Field Collection EPMF Employee Plan Master File IDRS Integrated Data Retrieval System IMF Individual Master File IRAF Individual Retirement Account File NMF Non-Master File TC Transaction Code TIF Taxpayer Information File

) By requesting a notice status, STAUP will interrupt, delay, accelerate or skip routine notice issuance. If a notice is requested, the number of cycles delay before issuance of the notice is required. An automatic status delay update to the next sequential notice status, or a request to mark the last issued CP

notice as destroyed and request another can be requested for IMF, BMF, and IRAF (not NMF) cases. If the module qualiﬁes for issuance of the notice requested, the weekly update will cause the notice to issue when the number of cycles delay has expired. (
) The statuses (notices) progress as follows:
2.4.28.2(01-01-2023) CC STAUP Notice Requests
Command Codes STAUP, STATI and STATB 2.4.28 page 3
(3) If the status requested is a notice status, the status generated by CC STAUP will be as follows:
The weekly analysis will generate the appropriate notice and status when the number of cycles delay input has expired, or earlier depending on control base information.
The weekly analysis will generate the appropriate notice and status when the number of cycles delay input has expired, or earlier depending on control base
number of cycles delay input has expired, or earlier depending on control base information. a. If the requested number of cycles delay is
, the delay is not affected by the absence, presence, or status of any control base. The delay is released when the input number of cycles lapse. b. If the requested number of cycles delay is

, the delay may be released earlier depending on control base information as follows: After weeks delay, if there is at least one open control base, release the delay after the full number of cycles input or, if there is no open control base, look to release the delay the later of
weeks after input (status cycle +
), or

weeks from the most recently closed control base. c. Deﬁne “minimum number of cycles delay” as the number of cycles the STAUP will delay the notice regardless of the absence, presence, or status of any control base. It is also the earliest the delay will release. The value of minimum is

d. Deﬁne “balance of cycles delay” as the number of cycles over the minimum delay, during which the delay may be released depending on control base information. e. Deﬁne “maximum number of cycles delay” as the total number of cycles input. It is equal to the minimum number of cycles delay + the balance of cycles delay. f. Control bases do not extend the delay past the maximum number of cycles requested.
) A request to mark the CP
notice as destroyed (“D”) will cause the Notice Suppress Code for the latest CP
entry in the Notice History Section to updated to
A request to mark the notice as destroyed and to request another (“R”) will cause the Notice Suppress Code to be updated as above, and will be treated like a status request
) Command Code STAUP will only prevent an erroneous IDRS notice if it is input by the Friday before the erroneous notice is scheduled to generate (
days prior to the
C date). (
) The command code STAUP with a deﬁner of “I” must be input prior to using the command code STATI (deﬁner blank) initially. The prerequisite will return format screen with literals displayed on lines
(See Exhibit
, STATI, STATB Format Screen Output). The terminal will then be ready for status update requests. (
) The command code STAUP with a deﬁner of “B” must be input prior to using the command code STATB (deﬁner blank) initially. The prerequisite will return format screen with literals displayed on lines
(See Exhibit
, STATI, STATB Format Screen Output). The terminal will then be ready for status update requests. (
) Each input ﬁeld of the format screen will be preceded by a > symbol. The cursor will move automatically to the next ﬁeld when ﬁeld input is completed by use of the tab key. (
) The Status Request ﬁeld of the format screen will display an asterisk signifying automatic default to the next sequential status unless overwritten by a speciﬁc status request. (
) STATI and STATB both accept up to
lines of input, one tax module to a Every screen line will be validated and processed. If all input is valid and no errors occur, the screen will be returned with “ STATI” or “STATB” on line
, literals on lines
and “REQUEST COMPLETED” on line
) If a deﬁner other than I, B, or S is erroneously input, the screen will be returned with the message “INVALID DEFINER” on line
The exception deﬁner “F”, which if erroneously input will return the message “DEFINER F INVALID - PLEASE USE I OR B.” Any status update request inputs on lines through
will not be processed and will be redisplayed. (

) If a data item on a screen line is in error or invalid, the item in error and an error code at the end of the screen line will be displayed in inverse video. to three alpha characters may appear as error codes for a screen line (See IRM
, CC STAUP, STATI, STATB Error Codes for an explanation of error codes.) The message “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA” will be displayed on line
All valid input lines will have been processed and will disappear from the screen. (
) A repeat indicator (“R”) may be input in the second position of screen lines through

This will indicate that the TIN and File Source and possibly other information from the prior line will be repeated on the “R” line. The position each data item on the line will be checked. If it is blank, the data from the
IDRS Terminal

STATI and STATB both accept up to 17 lines of input, one tax module to a line. Every screen line will be validated and processed. If all input is valid and no errors occur, the screen will be returned with “ STATI” or “STATB” on line 1, the literals on lines 2 & 3 and “REQUEST COMPLETED” on line 24.
Command Codes STAUP, STATI and STATB 2.4.28 page 5
preceding line will be used. Thus the terminal operator will have to input only the Tax Period, Status Requested, Number of Cycles Delay and those items which differ from the previous line.
preceding line will be used. Thus the terminal operator will have to input the Tax Period, Status Requested, Number of Cycles Delay and those items which differ from the previous line. (
) STAUP with a “S” deﬁner will accept a single line of input using only the requested status and number of cycles delay. To use STAUP in this manner (See Exhibit

, CC STAUP Command Code Deﬁner “S”), the command code TXMOD will be a prerequisite. The TIN must also be present on line Invalid data or entries will be handled the same way as multiple inputs, all ﬁelds being displayed. Error codes at the end of the screen line and erroneous data ﬁelds will be displayed in inverse video. (
) The ﬁrst ﬁeld on line

, an automatic status delay update to the next sequential status for the displayed number of cycles is being requested (not allowed NMF cases). If the value in this ﬁeld is greater than
, the request is for update to that speciﬁc status for the number of cycles displayed in the next ﬁeld. STATI, Checks (
) Following are the validity checks for CC STAUP, STATI and STATB input status update requests, and Tax Module requirements. STATI, Items (
) The TIN must be a valid TIN. If the TIN is valid it is checked for consistency with the ﬁle source, if present. (
) If using STATI, all the accounts processed must be IMF. If using STATB, of the accounts processed can be IMF. IMF and non-IMF accounts can not processed in the same batch. (
) The Name Control must match the name control on the TIF. (
) The employee must be proﬁled to access the IMF/non-IMF account requested. (
) The MFT and Tax Period must be valid, and consistent with each other and with the TIN. (
) The Status Requested and Number of Cycles Delay will be checked for input line as described below.
) STAUP with a “S” deﬁner will accept a single line of input using only the requested status and number of cycles delay. To use STAUP in this manner (See Exhibit
, CC STAUP Command Code Deﬁner “S”), the command code TXMOD will be a prerequisite. The TIN must also be present on line

) The TIN must be a valid TIN. If the TIN is valid it is checked for consistency with the ﬁle source, if present. (

And (

) All data items on a screen line will be validated and processed. When a has been correctly processed, it is blanked out. If all input lines are processed correctly, a blank screen will be returned with the message “REQUEST COMPLETED-(SC Abbreviation).” The service center abbreviation is that service center the request was routed to. If a data item is invalid, that item an error message (signiﬁed by an alpha character) will be displayed in video. Up to three error messages (characters) can be displayed at the end a line. An error in one line will not prevent processing of further lines; all on the screen will be processed. The screen will be returned with all of the error lines moved up to the top of the screen. An error message “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA-(SC Abbreviation).” The service center abbreviation of the service center the request was routed to will appear on line
of screen. If it is intended that the erroneous line is not to be re-input, then it must be blanked out Line (

through will not have been processed. Line
will be used only for returning screen messages to the terminal operator. (

) The typical messages returned to the terminal operator and their meanings are: a. REQUEST COMPLETED-(SC Abbreviation) — all data validated and processed. b. PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA-(SC Abbreviation) — an error been detected in one or more input lines. (Invalid ﬁelds and an error code at the end of the input line will appear in inverse video.) For de- scription of error codes See IRM

, CC STAUP, STATI, STATB Error Codes. c. INVALID DEFINER — a deﬁner other than “I”, “B”, “S”, or “F” has used. d. DEFINER F INVALID — PLEASE USE I OR B -deﬁner “F” has been used. e. NO DATA INPUT — no input on Lines
through

— data is present on lines
Codes (

) All elements of data from the input screen will be validated. If any data is invalid, the entire line of input will be displayed for potential operator correc- tion. The error ﬁeld will display in inverse video, and an error code will be displayed as an alpha character following the erroneous input line. Up to alpha error codes may be shown on each line where an error condition is covered. (
) Following are the meanings and conditions for each error code.
IDRS Terminal

All data items on a screen line will be validated and processed. When a line has been correctly processed, it is blanked out. If all input lines are processed correctly, a blank screen will be returned with the message “REQUEST COMPLETED-(SC Abbreviation).” The service center abbreviation is that of the service center the request was routed to. If a data item is invalid, that item and an error message (signiﬁed by an alpha character) will be displayed in inverse video. Up to three error messages (characters) can be displayed at the end of a line. An error in one line will not prevent processing of further lines; all lines on the screen will be processed. The screen will be returned with all of the error lines moved up to the top of the screen. An error message “PLEASE CORRECT INVALID DATA-(SC Abbreviation).” The service center abbreviation of the service center the request was routed to will appear on line 24 of the screen. If it is intended that the erroneous line is not to be re-input, then it must be blanked out

The erroneous input item(s) will be displaced in inverse video along with an alpha error code(s) at the end of the line also in inverse video. Valid input lines will be processed and blanked out. Invalid lines will be moved to the top of the screen.

Record Element Description

ITEM LINE POSITION DESCRIPTION 1 1 1–5 Command Code - STATI or STATB 2 2–3 1–60 Literal screen lines 3 4–20 1–59 Input screen lines 4 24 2–24 Error message — “NO INPUT” or “DATA INVALID ON LINE 21–24” or “DEFINER F INVALID - PLEASE USE I OR B” or “INVALID DEFINER”
Screen lines 2 through 20 will be redisplayed, but no data will have been processed.
